PIT_ADMIN Body

Implements PIT administration methods

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Published under MIT licence

Private type definitions
predefined_error_rec

Record to store details for a named Oracle error

Properties
source_type

Type of data object in which the error is defined

owner

Owner of the data object that defines the error

package_name

Name of the data object that defines the error

error_name

Name of the error

Private constants
Constants
C_PIT_PARAMETER_GROUP

Parameter group for PIT parameters

C_CONTEXT_PREFIX

Prefix for context names

C_TOGGLE_PREFIX

Prefix for toggle names

C_XLIFF_NS

Namespace of XLIFF

C_MIN_ERROR

First error number PIT uses for error numbering

C_MAX_ERROR

Last error number PIT uses for error numbering

C_FATAL

Level fatal, defined here to avoid dependency on PIT_PKG

C_ERROR

Level error, defined here to avoid dependency on PIT_PKG

C_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE

Sort sequence for the default language

Private package variables
Package variables
g_predefined_errors

List of predefined errors found in existing packages

g_default_language

ORacle name of the default language

Generic helper methods
initialize_error_list
procedure initialize_error_list

Method to collect all predefined error names within the database.  Is called during package initiazation.

check_error
procedure check_error(
p_pms_name in pit_message.pms_name%type,
p_pms_custom_error in pit_message.pms_custom_error%type
)

Helper to check whether a predefined Oracle error is to be overwritten.

Is called whenever a new message is inserted into table MESSAGE with an Oracle error number.  The function checks whether the Oracle error number is already a named error, such as -1 and DUP_VAL_ON_INDEX.  If so, the procedure throws an error.

Limitation

This procedure can only see Exceptions that are defined in packages from SYSTEM or SYS and only exceptions from non wrapped sources.

Parameters
p_pms_name
in pit_message.pms_name%type

Name of the message to check the error for

p_pms_custom_error
in pit_message.pms_custom_error%type

Error number for which a PIT message shall be created

get_export_group_script
function get_export_group_script(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type
)
return varchar2

Method to create a script snippet for ex- or importing a message group

Parameter
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Optional name of the message to create a script for. If NULL, all message groups are exported

Returns

Script with a call to merge_message_group to import a message group or a list of message groups.

script_messages
procedure script_messages(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_file_name out nocopy pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_script out nocopy clob
)

Helper method to generate a message install script. Is called internally by create_installation_script

Parameters
p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group to filter output

p_file_name
out nocopy pit_util.ora_name_type

Out parameter that provides the file name for the Script file

p_script
out nocopy clob

Out parameter that contains the SQL script created

script_translatable_items
procedure script_translatable_items(
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null,
p_file_name out nocopy pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_script out nocopy clob
)

Helper method to generate a translatable items install script.  Is called internally by create_installation_script

Parameters

in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

p_file_name
out nocopy pit_util.ora_name_type

p_script

analyze_xliff
procedure analyze_xliff(
p_xliff xmltype,
p_pml_name out nocopy pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pmg_name out nocopy pit_message_group.pmg_name%type
)

Method to extract language and group from an XLIFF envelope. Is used to extract information from an XLIFF header.

Parameters
p_xliff
xmltype

XLIFF instance

p_pml_name
out nocopy pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Language name converted to Oracle language name

p_pmg_name
out nocopy pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Group name

translate_messages.

Helper method to extract XLIFF instance into PIT_MESSAGE. Is called internally by apply_translations.

Parameter
p_xliff

XLIFF instance to apply

translate_translatable_items
procedure translate_translatable_items(
p_xliff in xmltype
)

Helper method to extract XLIFF instance into PIT_TRANSLATABLE_ITEM.  Is called internally by apply_translations.

Parameter p_xliff - XLIFF instance to apply

get_pms_xml
function get_pms_xml(
p_target_language in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null
)
return xmltype

Help method to generate XLIFF compatible translation entries for messages.  <Is called internally by get_translation_xml> to allow for different target types.

Parameters
p_target_language
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Language to translate the messages to

p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Message group to tranlsate

Returns

XML fragment to incorporate into an XLIFF envelope generated by get_translation_xml

get_pti_xml
function get_pti_xml(
p_target_language in pit_message_language.pml_name%type,
p_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type default null
)
return xmltype

Help method to generate XLIFF compatible translation entries for translatable items.  Is called internally by get_translation_xml to allow for different target types.

Parameters
p_target_language
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Language to translate the translatable items to

p_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Translatable items group to tranlsate

Returns

XML fragment to incorporate into an XLIFF envelope generated by get_translation_xml

initialize
procedure initialize

Initialization procedure.

Called internally. It has the following functionality:

  • Read all predefined oracle errors from the oracle packages

  • Read default language
